intro: Haumaniastrum villosum, commonly known as the hairy goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant is distinguished by its soft, hairy foliage and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Haumaniastrum villosum is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
